name: Butternut Squash with Spicy Chili
ingredients: 2 red chillies, seeded and finely chopped
410g can of kidney beans, drained and rinsed
directions: 1. Preheat the oven to 200°C. Rub the squash halves with a little oil and then roast them on the baking sheet for 45 minutes until soft.

2. Meanwhile, heat the remaining oil in a large frying pan and then fry the onion for a few minutes until soft. Stir in the chillies and cumin, fry for 1 minute more and then add the mince, browning for 3-4 minutes. Stir in the puree and beans with a splash of water and season. Warm through and keep warm.

3. Scoop out a little of the soft squash to make a hollow and then stir this into the chilli with half the coriander. Fill the cavity of each squash with a quarter of the mix then scatter with the remaining coriander. Dress the spinach with a drop more olive oil, season and serve alongside squash.
